meanings.sent1: The loud thunderstorm filled the little girl with terror.
meanings.sent2: The horror movie was full of terror-inducing scenes.
meanings.sent3: The tiny puppy barking at its reflection in the mirror was a source of terror for the tough-looking bulldog.
meanings.sent4: The darkness of the forest at night cast a blanket of terror over the hikers.
meanings.sent5: The haunted house was designed to evoke a sense of terror in its visitors.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that causes intense fear
meanings.sent1: The monster in the story was a terror to all the villagers.
meanings.sent2: The haunted house was a popular Halloween attraction, known for being a terror to visitors.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon that kept stealing food from the campsite became a little terror to the campers.
meanings.sent4: The sudden appearance of the ghostly figure was a terror to the unsuspecting travelers.
meanings.sent5: The loud noise coming from the old house turned out to be a harmless cat, not a real terror.

meanings.definition: The state of being terrified or extremely frightened
meanings.sent1: Her face showed pure terror when she saw the spider crawling towards her.
meanings.sent2: The news of the approaching storm filled the town with terror.
meanings.sent3: The little boy's exaggerated terror at the sight of a harmless ladybug made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The eerie silence in the abandoned house added to the feeling of terror among the explorers.
meanings.sent5: The sudden scream in the dark alley sent waves of terror through the night.
